messages: f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:34): Darnit, everyone's gone.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:35): What's going to happen if filter-mappng has a URL mapping of say `/pattern/myservlet'
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:36): And the web app actually contains a directory with `/pattern/myservlet/'
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:37): Then, is the filter invoked for say domain.tld/myapp/pattern/myservlet/somepoor.jsp?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:56): What if `/pattern/myservlet/somepoor.jsp' is also a URL-mapping to yet another filter?

f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:58): <filter-mapping><filter-name>hello...<url-pattern>/pattern/myservlet</...> <filter-mapping<filter-name>bye...<url-pattern>/pattern/myserlvet/somepoor.jsp</...>
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:58): Actual structure of web app: /path/to/mywebapp/pattern/myservlet/somepoor.jsp
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (07:59): what's the relationship between Tomcat and, say, Tapestry? Or Spring?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:01): Divorced.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:03): Nothing at all to do with each other?
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:04): both apache projects..
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:05): I need to take a class just to understand the terminology
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:06): Well, Tapestry is a framework as for Tomcat is a web container that adheres to servlet/jsp specification to the teeth.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:07): So... Tapestry is a higher-level system that would run under Tomcat?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:08): More like on top of Tomcat.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:09): I've never played around with it so don't take my words for it.
08d86cdb7ee73ce6b6ddbf63b3cf0548 (08:09): Tapestry is a framework for building webapps.  Those webapps run in a servlet container, such as Tomcat.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:09): wsmoak_: okay, whew, that's what I thought, but couldn't find definitive info
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:09): Make it "web container" to encampus JSP as well. :)
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:10): so off i go to start down the Tomcat tutorials, then maybe look into Tapestry
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:10): thanks folks! majorly helpful
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:10): Try Strut as well.
08d86cdb7ee73ce6b6ddbf63b3cf0548 (08:10): Tapestry is one of many frameworks... JSF, Struts, Spring MVC, the list goes on.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:11): Tapestry and Spring appear to be the "next big thing"s
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:11): Ya, try to read on all of them see on the surface what each accomplishes and how.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:11): Then narrow down your interest and go with it.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:12): Well, I just lost my job, so I've got a little time for a new challenge to lead me into a new job
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:12): No, Iran is going to be a next big CABOOOM.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:12): What was your last job?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:12): kismet_, Sorry to hear that.

caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:13): thanks, Uviz. I was hired as a Level 1 Programmer, told I'd be working with .NET Framework, but turned out they're integration project required Perl, which I had NO experience with. Ugh, and this is MY fault?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:14): So they let you go?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:14): WTF! But they hired you based on your knowledge of .NET, not Perl.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:14): It was so awkward because no one I worked with had any idea what programming and web development was like or what it involved
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:14): Hah, so why they didn't fire the rest?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:14): What a whacky company.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:15): Yeah, they were just clueless, someone had apparently told them they would want .NET

f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:15): I mean, it happens time to time that people get hired for a certain position which later on turns out to be something else but they tell you to go ahead and learn, for instance, Perl.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:16): I did the crash course in Perl, and was finally getting around to working demos, but not fast enough for their percieved needs.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:16): That's just aweful. Did you move to a new location because of your hiring?
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:17): Nope, but I did have to put all my Personal Web Dev Clients on the far back burner, and now they all moved on with other developers
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:17): Were you doing ASP/PHP for your own clients?
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:18): And Javascript/Ajax, and general XHTML/CSS and web design
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:18): If you had clients, why did you move on to a company in the first place?
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:18): Well, only had 3 clients
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:18): Consulting beats being someone else's slave.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:19): So what made you decide to learn Servlet/JSP?
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:19): Full time job + Web Dev biz on the side was rather stressful and hard to pull off
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:19): I understand.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:20): I'm doing the full blitz, hoping to conquer all the major platforms and environments, so my demo apps can overshadow my lacking a degree
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:20): on the bright side, i did basically get paid for about a month to learn Perl, which is pretty frickin sweet
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:21): That can be a plan.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:21): Well, winning a $300 million lottery ticket is fricking sweet to me but everyone's standard differs.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:22): I'd been working as a Pharmacy Tech for 4 years at a crappy pharmacy chain, so the ridiculous short-lived job was still a MAJOR step up in the world. =)

f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:24): I really want to know what the hiring manager asked you in the interview that convinced him you are the right candidate despite the fact you probably had mentioned to him of your lack of experience with Perl.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:24): They had no idea Perl would be part of the plan
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:24): They figured that was my job to work out
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:24): I mean, either a position requires certain criteria that the candidate MUST meet or else...
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:25): And the rest of the team new Perl?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:25): s/new/knew

caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:26): LOL, hell no. 2 of my coworkers were the bosses who only knew "Management" and networking to interest people in buying into their franchise, 1 guy was the major tech guy who really only knew networking really well, and the other guy was just a repair tech
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:27): When you say networking, are you referring to network engineer, network admin, or network programmer?
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:27): So they really didn't know what Perl was, didn't know it was a fundamental tool for integrating with a new system
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:27): the bosses i mean networking socially/financially, setting up entrepreneurial sales meetings and such
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:28): Uhh, so I guess they wanted some Perl guru to come and do all the hard works and they take a wrap for it.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:28): Hahaha, that's funny, sales meetings, keke.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:28): They just wanted to buy someone who knew all the stuff they didn't know.
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:28): perl is diaper, you only use it once..
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:28): Which is actually a LOT that they didn't know
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:29): Good thing you got out.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:29): I feel like I should have fired them, frankly
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:30): I dunno, I took a shine to Perl, the whole CPAN thing, and all those great pre-built modules. The syntax and those sigils and dereferencing... YIKES
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:30): kismet my suggestion would get awesome at one tech and pretty good on a handful of others
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:31): Haha, Perl is just a glorified version of assembly... Syntax wise.
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:31): except when you write assembly you cant just 'hack it' like you can with perl
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:31): yeah, i'd like to pwn java and .net, and hone Perl, Python, and PHP
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:32): thats a fair whack
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:32): id suggest you pick one java or .net
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:32): i'd almost pass up ASP.NET, except it is in demand
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:32): cause they dont often cross over (except c#)
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:32): Or web services so be forced to learn a bit of both.
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:32): but you can only have so much of that active at any one time
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:33): ive built systems in all the above mentioned
4a75696134c268cf1b58158c11986d95 (08:33): but i only work in php, java atm
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:33): "and some of the technologies above mentioned."
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:33): Assembly FOR LIFE.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:34): yeah, so java is my least familiar as far as web applications, so that's the first stop
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:34): I remember the first time I saw SPARC assembly... I wanted to cry.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:34): Figure I'll put together some Tomcat stuff, then look into the frameworks
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:35): Tomcat stuff... mm'mm.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:36): I know this guy from the place I work, I gave him MS Office 2003 Pro the other day, he hasn't talked to me since.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:36): Microsoft breaks up friendships.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:36): cause he hates you now? or he's engrossed?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:37): I dunno, maybe he's sick or too busy.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (08:37): Ok, I gotta go to bed.
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:37): Nice chattin, thanks for the sympathy =) night
caa6d297c180089f6078e94288312156 (08:46): thanks guys! good night
